bug.author: justinclift
bug.description:
On CentOS 7 x64, make install goes into an endless loop. It looks like the Makefile is expecting a (probably newer) version of wget than provided with CentOS: <denchmark-code>wget: unrecognized option '--show-progress' Usage: wget [OPTION]... [URL]...
Try `wget --help' for more options. unzip: cannot find or open opencv.zip, opencv.zip.zip or opencv.zip.ZIP. wget: unrecognized option '--show-progress' Usage: wget [OPTION]... [URL]...
Try `wget --help' for more options. unzip: cannot find or open opencv_contrib.zip, opencv_contrib.zip.zip or opencv_contrib.zip.ZIP. rm: cannot remove â€˜opencv.zipâ€™: No such file or directory rm: cannot remove â€˜opencv_contrib.zipâ€™: No such file or directory </denchmark-code>
Removing the --show-progress option from the wget line seems to work, although the script bombs out later anyway with -- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!. (going to look into that shortly) As a general thought for troubleshooting, it'd probably be useful to have the Makefile detect when something goes wrong so it can skip the automatic rm -rf of the temp directory it builds OpenCV in. ðŸ˜‰ <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
